page.title: 03LOCAL NEWS
page.content: CHORLEY GUARDIAN 30 MAY l985-Ambitious plans for 300 acres of Birkacre Valley are the culmination of 8 months careful planning by Community Programme Workers They guarantee to return the eyesore into a regional showpiece,preserving this ancient historically important section of the Yarrow Valley. Plans to restore the area in 5 phases by l995, to a Country Park and Heritage Centre. With the creation of 300 jobs and spin off tourist and educational interests the benefits would be enormous.One Councillor fears industrial Disneyland if a Lancashire street,a forge mill, museum mining exhibition and other "unnecessary extras" are developed. He claims it cannot guarantee grants for the work costs of l5-40m.Central Govt financial aid could be available.The controversy continues as the Council debates the issue.
